introduction: In this lecture, we will learn how to generate basic graphic types such as scatter plot, line plot, and bar plot using R. We will also discuss the need for more sophisticated graphics and introduce the ggplot2 package for generating beautiful graphics. This concludes our module on data science for engineers.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Graphic Types
content: Explanation of scatter plot, line plot, and bar plot.
Generation of basic graphics in R.
Explanation of the challenges faced with basic graphics.
Introduction of ggplot2 package.

sections.title: Section 2: Scatter Plot
content: Explanation of scatter plot.
Generation of scatter plot in R.
Examples of scatter plots using built-in data sets.
Customization of scatter plot.

sections.title: Section 3: Line Plot
content: Explanation of line plot.
Generation of line plot in R.
Examples of line plots using built-in data sets.
Customization of line plot.

sections.title: Section 4: Bar Plot
content: Explanation of bar plot.
Generation of bar plot in R.
Examples of bar plots using built-in data sets.
Customization of bar plot.

sections.title: Section 5: ggplot2
content: Introduction to ggplot2 package.
Explanation of ggplot2 syntax.
Examples of ggplot2-generated graphics.
Comparison of ggplot2 with basic graphics.
